results.title: 2 Seconds = 2 secondes
results.creator_credit: Manon Briand, Roger Frappier, Studiofilms and Max Films
results.brief_description: Laurie (Charlotte Laurier) is a champion mountain bike racer whose career on the professional circuit comes to an abrupt end after hesitating for two seconds at the start of a race. Forced into retirement at 28, she moves to Montreal where she finds work as a bike courier. Her speed and passion for cycling impresses and threatens her colleagues as she weaves her way through traffic from one job to another. On one of her trips, a broken chain leads her to a bike store tucked away in a quiet street. There she meets the gruff Italian owner Lorenzo (Dino Tavarone), who was a cycling champion in his youth. Initially dismissive and suspicious of Laurie and her obsession with cycling, he slowly begins to trust her, recounting stories from his past on subsequent visits. Although Laurie and Lorenzo appear to move in different worlds, separated by age and gender, they gradually discover that essentially they have much in common, including their taste in women. Cast also includes Pascal Auclair, Yves Pelletier, Andre Brassard, Jici Lauzon and Louise Forestier. Photographed by James Gray; edited by Richard Comeau; music by Sylvain-Charles Grand and Dominique Grand. In French and English with English subtitles.

results.title: We're no angels
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Pat Duggan and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in French Guiana, three convicts escape from the notorious prison on Devil’s Island and hide amongst the colonists. In need of clothing and money, the three make plans to rob a milliner, Felix, and his family. The trio are deterred from their larcenous intents when they develop a fondness for the family. Discovering that Felix is on the verge of bankruptcy, the convicts offer their services as household help. Matters are further complicated when they discover that Felix’s wealthy cousin arrives to audit the books. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Aldo Ray, Peter Ustinov, Joan Bennett and Basil Rathbone.

results.title: The Luzhin defence
results.creator_credit: Marleen Gorris, Phillipe Guez, Louis Becker, Stephen Evans, Caroline Wood, ICE3 and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Adapted from the Vladimir Nabokov novel, “The Luzhin Defence” tells the story of Luzhin, a chess grandmaster who arrives at a lakeside resort in Como, Italy, to partake in the World Championship Tournament. Luzhin is an idiot savant whose obsession with chess has cost him the ability to function in society. Exploited by his teacher during his adolescent years, Luzhin has become introverted and prone to outbursts of indecipherable nonsense until he meets Natalia, a society beauty who is also staying at the resort. She resolves to offer him a world outside that of chess, but it is a world that Luzhin is not equipped to deal with. Cast includes: John Turturro, Emily Watson, Geraldine James, Stuart Wilson, and Chris Thompson.

results.title: Lawn dogs
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Duncan Kenworthy and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Camelot Gardens is a “gated community” for the wealthy with luxurious yet sterile homes, and a security force which ensures that riff-raff will be kept off the grounds after dark. The Stockard family are the new kids on the block, obsessed with acceptance and political advancement within the community. Their ten year old daughter, Devon (Mischa Barton), is not interested in befriending children her own age. One day she wanders into the nearby woods and discovers Trent, a 22 year old who scrapes together a living by mowing the lawns of the wealthy inhabitants of Camelot Gardens. Both Trent and Devon have physical and emotional scars to deal with, and they soon become friends. However, things come to head when the community discovers that Devon’s best friend is a grown man. Cast also includes: Sam Rockwell, Chris McDonald and Kathleen Quinlan.

results.title: Escape from New York
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco, Debra Hill and AVCO Embassy Pictures
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s “Escape from New York” images the entire metropolis as a maximum security prison, where dangerous criminals and political dissidents are sent to serve out life sentences with no chance of parole. Carpenter’s dystopic vision populates the crumbling city with subway dwelling nomads and marauding gangs that rule the streets with chaos and destruction. When the President of the United States (Donald Pleasence) crashes his plane into the prison area, condemned criminal and one time war hero Snake Plissken (played with laconic glee by Kurt Russell), is sent in to rescue him from the highly dangerous fortress. Carpenter’s cult hit is a subversive and satirical take on a New York which was at the time (it was made in 1982), riddled with crime and corruption. The film also takes swipes at right wing paranoia by offering an alarming vision of how the average American would really like to solve escalating crime. Cast includes Isaac Hayes, Harry Dean Stanton, Ernest Borgnine, Lee Van Cleef and Adrienne Barbeau.

results.title: She's so lovely
results.creator_credit: Nick Cassavetes, Rene Cleitman, Clyde is Hungry Films, Cie, Hachette Premiere and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Sean Penn and Robin Wright Penn play husband and wife Eddie and Maureen whose devotion to each other is hindered by the self destructive behaviour which eventually leads Eddie to an institution for the criminally insane. During his ten year confinement, Maureen divorces Eddie without his knowledge, marries successful businessman Joey (John Travolta), and settles into middle class comfort to raise her three daughters. On the day of Eddie’s release, Maureen is unsettled by the emotional conflict which forces her to choose between her responsibility towards the husband she abandoned and the family that provided a refuge from her past. Based on a screenplay by John Cassavetes. Cast also includes Harry Dean Stanton, Gena Rowlands, Debi Mazar and James Gandolfini. Edited by Petra von Oelffen. Photographed by Thiery Arbogast. Music by Joseph Vitarelli.

results.title: In the name of the father [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Gabriel Byrne and Hell's Kitchen
results.brief_description: Gerry Conlon, a petty crook in Belfast during the 1970’s, gets in trouble with the IRA. His father sends him to England where a twist of fate puts him in the wrong place at the wrong time when a pub in Guildford is bombed. Gerry and three of his friends, although innocent, are charged and convicted. Gerry’s father joins him in prison and despite years of a strained relationship, Gerry learns to regard his father’s gentle spirit as a strength. Enlisting the aid of a lawyer, Guiseppe Conlon is determined to prove his son’s innocence, and when he dies in prison, Gerry is determined to take up the cause. Evidence is discovered which implicates senior police officials in a massive cover-up, and the ‘Guildford Four’ are finally set free. Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite and Emma Thompson are brilliant in their roles.

results.title: The Mummy returns
results.creator_credit: Steven Somers, Sean Daniel, James Jacks, Alphaville and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and Arnold Vosloo return to star in this sequel to the 1999’s blockbuster, ‘The Mummy’. When evil mummy Lord Imhotep is resurrected in a British museum, Rich and Evie O’Connell develop feelings of deja-vu. The situation worsens when their son Alexander discovers the ancient arm bands belonging to the Scorpion King and puts them on, which will awaken the Scorpion King and bring forth the end of the world. When Imhotep discovers the wearer of the bracelets and the only thing standing in his way of reigning again is a child, he arranges for the child to be kidnapped, leaving Evie and Rich only days to save their son and the world from Imhotep and the Scorpion King. Cast also includes wrestling star The Rock, AKA Dwayne Johnson, as the Scorpion King.

results.title: Down by law [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Alan Kleinberg, Grokenberger and Black Snake
results.brief_description: It is a sad and beautiful world that provides the setting for Jim Jarmusch’s third feature. It seems like a world of bad luck and trouble to Jack and Zack. These deadbeats may well have deserved a comeuppance, but not jail, certainly not for the long haul, and absolutely not in the same cell together. The big-talking, foolish Jack and the sullen, daydreaming Zack are mutually repellent. A new convict is pushed into their cell, an Italian tourist, Roberto. Somehow the three manage to escape and they wind up in the trackless bayou, pursued by bloodhounds. Cast includes Tom Waits, John Lurie, Roberto Benigni and Ellen Barkin.

results.title: Sleeping dogs
results.brief_description: Against the background of political turmoil a loner on the run is caught between the forces of a repressive government and guerillas in the resistance movement in this fast paced political thriller/action/buddy movie. Set in an imagined totalitarian future, the film and the book on which it was based foresaw some of the confrontations between authorities and protesters that marked the 1981 Springbok Rugby Tour of New Zealand. The debut feature for both director Roger Donaldson and actor Sam Neill, this film is recognised as marking the beginning of contemporary New Zealand cinema. Cast includes Sam Neill, Ian Mune, Warren Oates, Nevan Rowe and Donna Akersten. Based on the novel ‘Smith’s Dream’ by C.K. Stead. Reference: ‘New Zealand Film 1912-1996’ eds. Helen Martin and Sam Edwards. Oxford University Press, Auckland 1997.
